title: fuk you riot
body:
my message is simple go fuck yourself riot. im sitting waiting for a que dodge to subside because i dodged an aram. i did this because for the 3rd game in a row i have been placed with 2 bots i can now recognize by name. this was reported in both games but you lazy %%%%s refuse to do anything about it. why have an event on specializing in aram matches if their is no point because its so full of bots you wont do fuck all about because its just easier for you to sit back and count rp sales. sincerely from a long time player i hope you can muster up a fuck or two , switch on and actually do something to help this game. lazy bunch of useless %%%%s.

replies.body:
Funnily enough, I recently read that Riot are making changes to how the game itself runs, which is going to make scripting and botting a lot harder to do in the first place. It seems like they have held off on this change because it will also mean the death of custom skins and custom sound files.

I feel your frustration man, but the perspective you have of Riot just really isn't accurate.
I welcome you to do some research on the things you have complained about, I think you'll find the truth to be much happier than your version. :)

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

It wont do anything about scripting

If youve ever been in the hacking scene for even a few minutes you will know the mantra.

"They build a bigger wall we build a bigger sledgehammer"

Take eden eternal, i was pretty big in the botting scene for that game.

They tried to stop us from botting by randomising the memory addresses.

It did stop us for awhile.

Then we created a method thats completely unblockable without locking down the memory addresses, called a code cave.

We basically just nulled out a few addresses then rewrote them to do what we want them to do.
I appreciate the input, yet Riot have to take steps, no? Even if it's just to be seen as acting against it.

Theres right ways to do it and shitty ways to do it.

The method riot is taking wont stop scripting, at all.

But will stop custom skins.

Thats a negative loss no matter which way you spin it, we as the community gain nothing from that, and riot gains the ability to control their content more, thats all that changes.

Ill give it, a week before bots come back after that.

If riot really want to stop botting? theres 2 ways to do it.

offer rewards to people who hand in source code of bots, so riot can read the code and specifically block the methods used, which proven successful in the past by companies like red 5.

Or completely lock the memory addresses, not the files, which bots dont use.

The memory addresses, which bots do use.

If you cant edit the address in cheat engine, the bot cant either.

A third way to do it since riot loves automatic systems, is to exploit the predictable nature of bots.

Even if you randomize a click duration for a bot you still to assign a range, and keep it low enough to be optimal, if a player is clicking for exactly 50ms every time he clicks, hes not human, you can detect that very very easily.

In the randomised version they may click for a time between 40ms and 60ms, but due to how rng works its still going to average out to around 50ms. and other things like that, maybe they move their mouse in perfectly straight lines with no jiggle which a human will always have from their mouse movement, bot detected.

Maybe they dont move their mouse at all, the cursor instantly teleports there in 1ms, bot detected, etc etc etc.

You can ban the hwid of the bot user, the hwid is unlike ip addresses or mac addresses, not that easy to spoof, because the unique id created by your cpu+mobo hwid's combined, and its unique, for every computer.

So unlike ip bans, you cant accidently ban an entire student dorm, you just ban the laptop of the guy botting.

Now he has to buy a new laptop, or a new motherboard for his pc to be able to play league.

Hell id much rather every ban be a hwid ban, so people dont just go "meh got my account banned ill just play one of my 55 alt accounts"

The loss of custom skins is deeply upsetting, but I read a post once stating that Riots only concern with custom skins, was that people might start recreating the skins they sell to use them for free. That such a thing would result in the issue of custom skins being reevaluated. I guess that has happened?

Either that, or they are really convinced that this new system they are working on will be a good fix.

But from why you're saying, that doesn't seem very likely.

Just theory crafting here, but what if they just made it so impossibly terrible scores, eg, 0/20/0 resulted in not earning any Xp for that match?

That would actually work yes, it wouldnt actually stop the bots, but itd stop people having a reason to bot.

Or at the very least they would greatly increase the complexity of their bots so that said bots dont feed, which would atleast give us decent aram games again.

That is what would deter them though, as the more complex you make the bot the more system resources it would use (they dont use alot but when you are running a couple hundred bots in a farm to level accounts to sell a 1% increase in resources could be devastating)

"hacking scene"

your stupid scripting isn't hacking it uses the files from the game and creates scripts around them to make you perform automatic functions, the scripts may be coded but it doesn't make it hacking. also it will do a lot because it will now detect files out of the norm of league of legends and probably send details to riot, leading to the ban of people who use customs and stuff.

you say "us" like you have any idea what linux is, lmao

also how are you hardstuck bronze 5 if you script?

Oh sweet sweet child.

Im the documentation editor over at blue-eye macro.

Do you know what that means? i am single handedly the person most trusted by the dev to know enough about his language to write the fucking documentation for it.

Im no fucking script kiddie.

Not to mention my 8 years of experience with c++

And 3 years working with assembly code.

Sorry i should specify that by assembly i mean intel x86 op codes.

Please, sit your ass down.

Also by definition hacking is to "gain unauthorized access to data in a system or computer."

Which in the case of a game hack, is to gain unauthorized access to the memory pointers of the game to be read or manipulated.

Scripting is by definition hacking.

The term scripting was coined as a script is a file, written is a custom language, designed to make coding for said purpose of the script easier and more efficient (the code isnt more efficient but thats not what i mean by efficient)

You could argue that scripting is easier than coding from scratch, and i would agree with you.

But autohotkey, autoit, lua, l#, they arent plain english languages, blue eye macro is, but blue eye macro is also extremely complex once you start looking under the hood, infact it being plain english is in my opinion a good thing, because it allows you to write down 20 thousand line scripts on paper, and 9/10 there wont be any syntax errors because its plain english, so you just remember what every command does, for instance variable.add(math)("","") is very clearly a function which adds a value to a numerical integer.

But rant about my favourite scripting language aside, scripting is just coding in a fancy wrapper.

Infact all of the scripting languages i just mentioned do exactly the same thing, provide an abstraction layer between the user and a series of .net functions.

Thats it, thats all they do, they function identically to a code written natively in a .net framework, because every single last command in that script is a just a function call with input variables, and that function is written in whatever language the author chose to write their engine in, using a .net library.

Bar lua of course, it is its own language in its own right, but when used for scripting its usually piped through a parser that converts it into .net library commands.


Just like how C++ is an abstraction layer for binary.

And just as scripting is coding in a fancy wrapper.

Hacking, is just using a method to bypass a limitation, in a fancy wrapper.

Thats why hacking doesnt mean coding.

For instance, if i was to find out who you are, then find your accounts security question, then find out the answer to said question by observing you, and asking your friends, that is also a form of hacking, its called social engineering, or as i like to call it, human hacking.

For example L#, its very easy to tell how L# works, they have a set of memory pointers that they know controls certain commands or contain certain data.

Take for example, fog of war hacks, there isnt some tricky shit going on there, L# is simply taking the information the client already has, cracking it open like a wallnut, and then showing you all the goodies inside.

A simple fix for that, well not simple but a fix, would be for riot to change the way the server gives map information, namely just stop giving the location of every player in the game regardless of vision, that wouldnt last long as that would require a client side function to call certain pieces of information from the server, and anything client side can inturn be hacked and then controlled, but it would atleast deter them.

But like i said, if riot really wants to stop scripters, they need to lock down their memory addresses, blocking custom files, doesnt stop anything, as they dont need custom files to script.

The event doesn't specialise in ARAM, you don't have to earn Ocean Week points in ARAM. They just intentionally put the shorter game modes of ARAM and TT on "bonus" during the weekdays because they know that full-time working crew may appreciate this sort of thing. ARAM goes on bonus in Mon and Tue, TT goes on bonus between Wed and Thurs, and SR goes on bonus on Fri and weekends; that's pretty cute of them to set it up like that. But I guess in your eyes that's "its just easier for you to sit back and count rp sales", how cynical.

However yes, ARAM bots has been a long running problem in this game, and for some reason Riot has not been successful in putting a stop to it. So it's simple, you can either put up with it and report every bot you see while praying that reports work as they do if people actually use them (as most people don't and they just RQ after a salty match), or you can just not play in ARAM and earn points in other modes instead.
Why not just play? Assume the enemy team also has bots and carry the easy game mode yourself. I don't see any reason to dodge ARAM.
